page.title: 08Scouting in Wetley Rocks
page.content: The First Wetley Rocks Cub Scout Troop was formed in 1977 for boys who are 8 to 10 years old. At the present time there are 25 members. Cubs learn basic camping skills at the meetings as well as working to gain badges in many different areas. The success of the Cub Scouts led to the formation of the Scout Troop in 1978 for boys between 10 & 15 yrs. Many varied activities are undertaken such as canoeing, mountain climbing and orienteering. The highlight of the Scout Year is the annual summer camp where the scouts camp away from home for a week, doing their own cooking and looking after themselves. After the age of 15 the boys may join the Venture unit which assists with the scout activities and organises adventurous activities for itself.
